entry.title: my first post
entry.content: hahaha Why Pythonopen source1234567import numpy as npimport pandas as pdfor i=1:length(n):# array([[1, 2], [3, 4]]) % asset_ipynb % scipy123456789101112131415161718192021222324for i=1:n fid=fopen(filenames{i},'r'); tline=fgetl(fid); % get the wavelengths from the 1st line wvl=str2num(tline(20:end)); % get all the labels label=[]; while ~feof(fid) tline=fgetl(fid); label0=textscan(tline,'%s %s %s %s',1); label=[label;label0]; end clear label0 fclose(fid) % get all the data data=dlmread(filenames{i},' ',1,4);qft_data.wvl=wvl;qft_data.label=label;qft_data.data=data;str=['qft_data' num2str(i) '.mat'];save (str,'qft_data','-mat') end

entry.title: hi
entry.content: 1print('I love Python') I love Python 12x = [1,2,3,4,5]plt.plot(x); --------------------------------------------------------------------------- NameError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-2-38b633f12fcd> in <module>() 1 x = [1,2,3,4,5] ----> 2 plt.plot(x); NameError: name 'plt' is not defined 12import matplotlib as pltplt.plot(x) --------------------------------------------------------------------------- AttributeError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-3-6a539ec243d1> in <module>() 1 import matplotlib as plt ----> 2 plt.plot(x) AttributeError: module 'matplotlib' has no attribute 'plot' 1plt.plot?? Object `plt.plot` not found. 12import matplotlib.pyplot as pltplt.plot(x) [<matplotlib.lines.Line2D at 0x11a002c50>] 123%matplotlib inlineimport matplotlib.pyplot as pltplt.plot(x) [<matplotlib.lines.Line2D at 0x11a08df98>]

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
